title: The White Dress: Queen Victoria's Invention
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The White Dress: Queen Victoria's Invention.

hook.text: White wedding dresses don't symbolize purity. They symbolize wealth. Queen Victoria started the trend in 1840.

buildup.text: Before Victoria, brides wore their best dress in any color. Red was popular in China, green in Ireland.

discovery.text: Victoria chose white to showcase expensive Honiton lace, supporting British industry. It was a political statement.

twist.text: The purity myth was added later by Victorian moralists. Victoria herself was passionately in love â€” nothing prudish.

climax.text: A tradition billions follow began as one queen's fashion choice and a marketing campaign for British lace.

punchline.text: The white dress isn't tradition. It's a 180-year-old fashion trend.

quiz.question: Why did Queen Victoria wear a white wedding dress?
